mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Scientists at microscopes in laboratory for specialized microscopical procedures

mods.mods:accessCondition: The Rockefeller Foundation twenty-year embargo has expired for these materials.

Photographs portray Rockefeller Foundation funded cell research at the Karolinska Institute. The grantee presumably commissioned the photos and submitted them as evidence of work accomplished through RF support. While they are not RF work for hire, the photographs may be considered commissioned works, submitted to the RF. We judge that we are, by extension, allowed to publish them with the appropriate photo credits.
No information has been found on photographer Inge Holm.
Photo number 22471g was published in the Rockefeller Foundation Annual Report for 1949, p. 205.
To the extent that the Rockefeller Foundation owns copyright in these materials, it has given the Rockefeller Archive Center the authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection for scholarly purposes.
